newsitem.title: GEORGIA: Floods leave several hundred homeless in Georgia.
newsitem.headline: Floods leave several hundred homeless in Georgia.

text.p: Spring floods in the former Soviet republic of Georgia have left several hundred people homeless, government officials said on Friday.
More than 80 buildings have been ruined in the town of Gori, 60 km (35 miles) west of the capital Tbilisi, Deputy Mayor Tamas Gurgenidze told Reuters.
The flooding began earlier in the week, when the Liahvi river burst its banks after weeks of heavy rain.
It was too early to make an estimate of damage to property, the deputy mayor said, but emergency measures were being taken and all damaged buildings would be repaired as soon as possible.
But some residents complained that the government had done nothing to help them.
